Now we start the real work.

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

For almost a decade, Kansas has been the epicenter of national voter suppression efforts. In this election, we voted our values and rejected those efforts. We are so grateful for all the work you have put in to make this possible. Thank you.

Making real changes to combat voter suppression means organizing and holding accountable our elected officials year-round, beyond the election season. Now is when we start taking action on expanding citizen participation.

Join the ACLU of Kansas for a Citizen Participation County Strategy Session on Wednesday, January 9.

Citizen Participation Strategy Session

Decide how to take action locally to expand voting rights in your county!

Wednesday, January 9, 6-8 p.m.
KCK South Library
3104 Strong Ave
Kansas City, KS 66106

The goal of this meeting is to join together with fellow community members and talk local strategy. Join us to find out where your legislators stand on the issue, how your countyâ€™s voting rights compare to the rest of Kansas, and make a plan of action to strengthen citizen participation in your own communities.
